posts.raw_content:
I cannot express to you how claustrophobic it feels when you have an issue like a bunch of money being tied up because the computer made a mistake and the only person you can talk to is India. So my dispute is actually between two companies I use my credit card to make a purchase and the merchant overcharged me. I filed the dispute after spending 2 hours on the phone with India at the company I bought from trying to solve the problem that was clearly their fault and they admitted it was their fault and that I would get the money back. I never did. So I filed a dispute and some other Indian at the company denied my dispute because he can't read and they don't care. So I'm still out my money and I have no choice but to bounce back between two Indian call centers at two different companies who don't even understand the nuance of my problem enough to help me, and the ones that do understand the nuance apparently failed to do the basic duties of their job.

I just spent 40 minutes on the phone with one company trying to get them understand a question that could have been answered by a walmart cashier in America in about 3 seconds. I don't get it like just charge me more money if you have to to give me an American call center that understands my problem.

This seems like low hanging fruit for Trump it would be really nice if he somehow put a tariff on overseas call centers Or found some way to force companies to use Americans for that.

 It would actually create decent remote jobs for people which even if they pay low they're still remote, I may have to listen to a smoke detector chirp but whatever at least the chirp would understand my problem.
